Package Maps

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Maps.Map
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArielMap, TelAvivMap

    public abstract class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    an abstract Map class which defines the basic properties of map such as image, current screen range, Geodetic Map range, and original screen range.

        public double getDistanceByPixel​(java.awt.Point p1,
                                 java.awt.Point p2)
        Get distance between two points on screen (pixels) in PIXELS!
        Note: Calculating the distance by current scaling, its not RAW distance and might change by screen size

        Returns:
        distance in SCREEN PIXELS.

      • getDistanceByPixelRaw

                                    java.awt.Point p2)
        Get distance between two points on screen (pixels) in PIXELS!

        Returns:

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle​(java.awt.Point p1,
                       java.awt.Point p2)
        Get the angle between two points on screen (pixels), in degrees.
        Note: Calculating Rescaled / non-original / non-Raw points. angle might be different with different screen sizes. unless given a Raw points as arguments.
        the angle is in degrees and in clockwise
        Directly Upwards = 0 degrees.
        Directly on the Right = 90 degrees.
        Directly Downwards = 180 degrees.
        Directly on the Left = 270 degrees
        Parameters:
        p1 - - point in pixels
        p2 - - point in pixels
        Returns:
        angle in degrees

      • getAngleRaw

        public double getAngleRaw​(java.awt.Point p1,
                          java.awt.Point p2)
        Get the angle between two points on screen (RAW pixels), in degrees.
        Note: calculating RAW points.
        First the function reverting the points into a RAW-pixel points, if Raw pixel points are passed as argument, the function would still try to revert the point to RAW as it doesn't recognize which is RAW and which isn't, please provide only Non-RAW pixel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        p1 - - point in pixels
        p2 - - point in pixels
        Returns:
        angle in degrees

      • updateLocationOnScreen

        public void updateLocationOnScreen​(GameSpirit obj,
                                   java.awt.Point p)
        Set new position to GameSpirit in pixels on screen, by using manipulation of current ScreenSize and MapSize to get the optimal result, the function also get into consideration scaling factors of the screen.
        Parameters:
        obj - the GameSpirit object to update it's position.
        p - a new location point to move to

      • updateLocationOnScreen

        public void updateLocationOnScreen​(GameSpirit obj,
                                   int x,
                                   int y)
        Set new position to GameSpirit in pixels on screen, by using manipulation of current ScreenSize and MapSize to get the optimal result, the function also get into consideration scaling factors of the screen.
        Parameters:
        obj - the GameSpirit object to update it's position.
        x - a new X location point to move to
        y - a new Y location point to move to

      • moveLocationByPixels

        public void moveLocationByPixels​(GameSpirit obj,
                                 int x,
                                 int y)
        Moving the GameSpirit object by x and y, with consideration of scaling factors of the screen.
        Parameters:
        obj - the GameSpirit object to update it's position
        x - amount of pixels to move to the right (positive) or left (negative)
        y - amount of pixels to move to downwards (positive) or upwards (negative)
